author: James Joyce
text: Dear Larbaud: Can you dine with me tonight? I hope so as I want to show you and comment on the new plan and discuss this matter which is rather delicate, I think, and important. As we shall dine at our end and I shall be at work all day would it be too much to ask you to call for me, say, at 7.30? I have seen the notice of your s√©ance and am glad and honoured to see our names associated for my first (or possibly last?) appearance before a French public Bien des choses James Joyce
